definitions.definition: (of a person or animal) To lose blood through an injured blood vessel.
definitions.example: If her nose bleeds, try to use ice.

definitions.definition: To let or draw blood from.
To take large amounts of money from.
(of an ink or dye) To spread from the intended location and stain the surrounding cloth or paper.
To remove air bubbles from a pipe containing other fluids.
To bleed on; to make bloody.
To show one's group loyalty by showing (its associated color) in one's blood.
definitions.example: He was a devoted Vikings fan: he bled purple.

definitions.definition: To lose sap, gum, or juice.
definitions.example: A tree or a vine bleeds when tapped or wounded.

definitions.definition: To issue forth, or drop, like blood from an incision.
(of a phonological rule) To destroy the environment where another phonological rule would have applied.
The flow or loss of blood from a damaged blood vessel.
definitions.example: Internal bleeding is often difficult to detect and can lead to death in a short time.
"You are a bleeding liar. Truth is of no interest to you at all." — http//groups-beta.google.com/group/comp.software.year-2000/msg/ba82c9dd28cde368
His car's motor is bleeding smoking down the motorway.
